clinical_study.brief_title: Lung Ultrasound Guided Protocol for Fluid Management for the Critically Ill Patient: a Randomized Study
clinical_study.official_title: Lung Ultrasound Guided Fluid Management Protocol for the Critically Ill Patient: a Randomized Study
clinical_study.source: Grigore T. Popa University of Medicine and Pharmacy

brief_summary.textblock: In the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) this bedside method of assessing lung congestion could be useful in a better management of the critically ill patients with a wide range of respiratory failure causes (Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome, COPD, acute pulmonary edema, pneumonia etc.). Fluid management is a key issue in the ICU where patients are either hemodynamic unstable and/or mechanically ventilated. A randomized study is proposed where in the interventional arm the fluid management (volume replacement, diuretics, use of vasopressors) will be guided using the BLS as a sign of pulmonary congestion.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The patients will be randomized in two groups: in the intervention group pulmonary congestion, as assessed by the BLS will guide the fluid management, with a target of below 15 BLS. In the control group the fluid management will not be LUS guided. In both groups, further complementary fluid assessment methods will be performed blindly from the investigators: body composition assessment by bioimpedance and biochemical panel consisting in cardiac biomarkers (NTproBNP, cTnT) and inflamatory markers (IL-6).
study_design_info.masking_description: Results of the lung ultrasounds will not be made publicly available

arm_group.description: in the intervention group pulmonary congestion, as assessed by the BLS will guide the diuretic and fluid management, with a target of below 15 BLS. Furthermore, in the active arm, in the patients who will require a renal replacement therapy (RRT), BLS will be used to further guide the dialysis fluid prescription.
control group the fluid management will not be LUS guided

intervention.description: We propose a randomized study where in the interventional arm the fluid management (volume replacement, diuretics, use of vasopressors) will be guided using the BLS as a sign of pulmonary congestion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 or older admitted to the Intensive Care Unit
Exclusion Criteria:
- known persistent pleurisy, pulmonary fibrosis or pneumectomy (due to lung ultrasonography limitations);
- unwillingness to participate in the study
